sections.title: 1. Introduction and Definitions
sections.content: These terms govern and control the relationship between the parties named herein. Revisions may be implemented to improve clarity and readability. You are advised to review and understand this agreement before using or conducting business with OozeCloud. 'You,' 'I,' 'the client,' or similar refer to the individual or entity purchasing or using our services. 'Us,' 'we,' 'our,' 'OozeCloud,' or 'the company' refer to OozeCloud. 'Services' include all products, website functionalities, and features provided by us.

sections.title: 2. Binding Terms
sections.content: By using or purchasing our services, you agree to all terms. These are subject to periodic review and modification without prior notice. Continued use signifies acceptance of future revisions. This agreement remains valid until your business relationship with OozeCloud concludes and your account is closed. Continued use also implies acknowledgment that regional rights may be waived, but the company will comply with applicable laws.

sections.title: 3. Revisions to this Agreement
sections.content: We reserve the right to modify, revise, or amend this agreement at any time. Continued use or business with us constitutes acceptance. The last update was on September 4, 2025, with periodic revisions every three months. Clients are responsible for reviewing this document regularly.

sections.title: 4. Warranties
sections.content: We make no representations or warranties regarding the accuracy or suitability of any information in this agreement.

sections.title: 5. General Governance and Arbitration
sections.content: No waiver or amendment is valid unless in writing, signed, and witnessed by an authorized OozeCloud representative. The agreement is governed by Utah law, USA. We prioritize data security and aim to comply with GDPR and US data regulations. Disputes are resolved via ICC arbitration at a location determined by OozeCloud, with mandatory arbitration prior to litigation. Efforts should be made to resolve disputes amicably beforehand.

sections.title: 6. Fair Use Policy
sections.content: For 'unlimited' or 'unmetered' services, clients must adhere to fair use standards. We reserve the right to enforce limits, terminate services immediately upon violation, and notify clients if resource usage exceeds 5%. No client shall use more than 10% of system resources or network bandwidth.

sections.title: 7. Abuse and Prohibited Activities
sections.content: Activities such as hacking, hosting illegal content, spamming, distributing malware, hosting child pornography, DDoS, doxing, selling illicit codes, or any activity illegal under US law are strictly prohibited. Additionally, contest winners must ensure their servers do not contain any illegal content, including piracy or cracked software. Servers found to host illegal content or piracy will be subject to removal from our hosting services immediately. Violations will result in immediate termination without refund.

sections.title: 8. Termination of Service
sections.content: Services may be suspended or terminated at any time for violations, with all data permanently deleted after 15 days unless lawfully retained. Clients are responsible for backups. Data related to abuse-related terminations may be retained for up to 365 days and shared with authorities. OozeCloud is not liable for any data corruption, loss, or damage that occurs during service provision or after, and clients are advised to maintain their own backups.

sections.title: 9. Payments, Cancellations, and Chargebacks
sections.content: Clients agree to pay in advance. Invoices are generated 15 days prior to due date. Automatic payments may occur if on file. Refunds are issued at our discretion, mainly for unresolved technical issues, with specific policies for certain services. Cancellations prevent future billing; refunds are limited to payments within the last 180 days. Chargebacks are prohibited and will result in immediate suspension, with possible reporting to credit bureaus and fraud prevention agencies.

sections.title: 10. Severability
sections.content: If any part of this agreement is deemed invalid or unenforceable, the remaining parts will remain in effect. Invalid provisions will be replaced with valid ones reflecting the original intent.

sections.title: 11. Indemnification and Miscellaneous
sections.content: You agree to indemnify OozeCloud against claims arising from your breach of this agreement, negligence, or illegal activities. We are not responsible for user-generated content. We may modify discounts or promotional offers at any time, and misuse of discount codes can lead to service termination.

sections.title: 12. Support and Ticket Response
sections.content: Support tickets will be responded to based on their priority level and the time of receipt. Urgent issues will receive prompt attention, while lower priority inquiries may experience longer response times. Clients are encouraged to provide detailed information to facilitate efficient resolution.

sections.title: 1. Introduction
sections.content: This policy outlines how we use your data, what data we collect and store, how we protect stored data, data retention, and waivers of rights. It also outlines our procedures for handling cases under the general data protection regulations in the European Union, as well as our further commitment to supporting industry best security practices and supporting the protection of children while they utilize our platform.

sections.title: 2. Data Protection Officer
sections.content: Allocated Data Protection Officer: Mr Austin Pasmore, tasked with observing and overseeing the active functions of this policy.

sections.title: 3. Binding Nature
sections.content: This policy remains in effect for the duration of your use of our services, with an additional term of five (5) years. By utilizing any service or part of our platform owned or controlled by us, you accept and agree to all clauses within this policy.

sections.title: 4. Children’s Privacy
sections.content: We may collect and store children’s information since our services are targeted towards children. Parental consent is required for children under 16. Children’s data is only shared with trusted third parties necessary for operation, and we never sell children’s data. Guardians are encouraged to review children’s activities online regularly. By using our platform, children and parents explicitly consent to this policy.

sections.title: 5. Data Retention
sections.content: We retain data for as long as necessary, typically 5 years after the data is no longer reasonably needed, for taxation and financial obligations. Logs and request data are retained indefinitely for security purposes. Service files are retained as long as necessary, even after business termination.

sections.title: 6. Data Erasure
sections.content: Clients can request data erasure by contacting Austin@oozecloud.com. Proof of identity may be required. The process involves a formal request, verification, and confirmation. Requests can be made by guardians for children under 13, with appropriate identification. If requests are lost or rejected, we are not responsible for damages.

sections.title: 7. Right of Appeal
sections.content: If you believe your erasure request was mishandled, you can appeal within 28 days of our final response. Failure to appeal within this period waives your right to do so.

sections.title: 8. Data We Collect
sections.content: We collect various data including personally-identifiable information (name, email, phone, address, IP, geolocation), cookies, log data (IP address, browser info, visit times), and data from third-party services such as Crisp Chat, Google Ads, Trustpilot, etc.

sections.title: 9. Access Arrangements
sections.content: Requests for access are supported only with a valid legal document, directed to compliance@sparkedhost.com. Access is limited to authorized employees under confidentiality agreements.

sections.title: 10. Review of Data
sections.content: You may request a data export once every 30 days, with up to six (6) requests per year. Additional requests may incur an $80 fee. Requests are made via email to compliance@oozecloud.com. Processing may take up to one month, and proof of ID is required.

sections.title: 11. Data Breaches
sections.content: In case of a breach, affected parties will be notified within 48 hours. We will disclose known details and suspend compromised services until resolved. Our DPO will guide next steps.

sections.title: 12. Data Collection Consent
sections.content: Using our services constitutes consent to data collection and processing as outlined in this policy.

sections.title: 13. Third-Party Links
sections.content: Links to third-party sites are not our responsibility. We advise reviewing their privacy policies before engaging.

sections.title: 14. Automated Content Scanning System
sections.content: We have implemented an automated scanning system that monitors content uploaded or shared on our platform. Access to this system is restricted to the CEO and Co-CEO. These executives receive notifications of any detected malicious or illegal content, enabling prompt action and ensuring compliance with legal and safety standards.

sections.title: 15. Changes to Policy
sections.content: We may update this policy at any time, posting changes on this page. Continued use of our services indicates acceptance of any updates.

sections.title: 16. Contacting the Data Protection Officer
sections.content: Questions or concerns? Contact our DPO at Voidpulse@oozecloud.com or Austin@oozecloud.com.
